Plot

Analysis & Visualization

Advanced data visualization with comprehensive plotting capabilities for data analysis using matplotlib and seaborn. Supports multiple chart types including line plots, bar plots, scatter plots, histograms, and heatmaps with extensive customization options.

1.0.0 Version
6 Actions
Jul 19 Updated
Python Language

Installation Methods

Quick Start

cd /path/to/scientific-mcps/Plot uv sync && uv run plot-mcp

UV Package Manager

uv sync uv run plot-mcp

Traditional pip

pip install -e . uv run python -m src.server

Claude Desktop

{ "mcpServers": { "plot-mcp": { "command": "uv", "args": [ "--directory", "path/to/directory/scientific-mcps/Plot/", "run", "plot-mcp" ] } } }

WARP Client

MCP: - Plot python3 bin/wrp.py --conf=bin/confs/Gemini.yaml

Claude CLI

npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code claude add mcp plot -- uv --directory ~/scientific-mcps/Plot run plot-mcp

Available Actions

  • data_info
    Get detailed information about dataset structure, column types, and basic statistics
    Parameters: data_file
  • line_plot
    Create line plots for time series data and continuous relationships
    Parameters: data_file, x_column, y_column, title, save_path
  • bar_plot
    Generate bar charts for categorical data visualization
    Parameters: data_file, x_column, y_column, title, save_path
  • scatter_plot
    Create scatter plots to visualize relationships between two continuous variables
    Parameters: data_file, x_column, y_column, title, save_path
  • histogram_plot
    Generate histograms to show distribution of continuous data
    Parameters: data_file, column, bins, title, save_path
  • heatmap_plot
    Create correlation heatmaps and matrix visualizations
    Parameters: data_file, title, save_path

Usage Examples

Create line plot from time series data

result = line_plot("/data/temperature.csv", "date", "temperature", "Temperature Trends")

Generate comprehensive data analysis

info = data_info("/data/sales.csv")

Create multiple visualizations for data exploration

scatter = scatter_plot("/data/sales.csv", "price", "quantity", "Price vs Quantity") hist = histogram_plot("/data/sales.csv", "revenue", bins=50, "Revenue Distribution") heatmap = heatmap_plot("/data/sales.csv", "Sales Correlation Matrix")

Bar chart with automatic data aggregation

bar = bar_plot("/data/categories.csv", "category", "sales", "Sales by Category")
